headline: Triple-Dipped Fried Chicken
description: This fried chicken batter yields the crispiest, spiciest, homemade fried chicken. Served hot or cold, this fried chicken is a picnic family favorite.

video.description: See how to make the crispiest, spiciest, homemade fried chicken ever.
video.name: Triple-Dipped Fried Chicken

name: Triple-Dipped Fried Chicken
recipeIngredient: 1 (3 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a deep fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix 3 cups flour, garlic salt, 1 tablespoon pepper, paprika, and poultry seasoning together in a medium bowl.
Stir 1 1/2 cups beer, remaining 1 1/3 cups flour, egg yolks, salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper together in a separate bowl; thin with more beer if batter is too thick.
Moisten chicken pieces with a little water, then dip in seasoned flour mixture. Shake off excess and dip in beer batter, then dip in the seasoned flour mixture once more.

Lower chicken pieces carefully into the hot oil in batches. Fry until crispy and well-browned, about 15 to 18 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.

review.reviewBody: This is by far the best fried chicken recipe I found so far. As other reviewers have said the amount of salt used has to adjusted to suit individual taste. I don't know about the beer. It was good. I may sub chicken broth next time to compare.

I made it twice but instead of using chicken pieces I made chicken strips from chicken breast my family loved it and so did I I'm going to make more today this will be my third time using this recipe very good recipe

Very good but I seasoned my chicken overnight because after reading the recipe I knew there wasn't enough flavor in the flour and then used the recipe for frying, I used water instead of beer the taste was great!!! Thanks for sharing this batter.
NEEDS MORE SEASONINGS BUT OTHERWISE VERY GOOD !
Would not recommend doing this recipe in the air fryer. In the oil it was amazing.
This came out so fabulous! I did 6 large breast pieces with the amount in the recipe, and I did my own herbs/spices combo. Super crunchy, fried up beautifully.
Love this recipe.... I omit the beer as I don't like the taste of beer, & instead of paprika, I use same amount of Frank's red hot powder.

Very good recipe my chicken came out extremely crispy and well done. I added Cajun seasoning, garlic powder, yellow mustard, salt on the chicken itself to let it marinate. I did not use beer( I drink it all)I use water instead and I cook the chicken wings for 10 minutes even. Will definitely do this again.
Insanely good! Have made it about 12 times. Change the oil out between batches if pan frying.

This was fairly easy and so very tasty. Loved that the coating stayed on and didn't fall off. Would add a light coat of garlic salt before the first coat, just for our taste. Better than KFC! Will be adding this to my favorite fried chicken recipes! Thx for sharing!
Added extra seasoning after reading the reviews and still bland.

Yes, crispy! I made chicken fingers using this dredge with my own creole seasonings and it was wonderfully crisp! My family ate it up üòã. Very pleased and will use again. Thank you. See my pic. üëç

I followed this recipe 3 times and even cooked it for less time and lower heat. Each time my chicken is dark and under cooked. Taste good after finishing in a skillet. Maybe my chicken too big idk. But this recipe isn't reliable.
Followed recipe to the letter. Very crispy. Absolutely bland. I would change the way to spice this up.

I really Loved the recipe. I did tweek it because personally i like more spice it was mild to mh taste so I added a lot more. Also i had more batter and stuff left over and added ranch powder to make ranch chicken same way.
I loved the triple coatings crunchy skin but juicy in the inside.

I love this coating great on chops as well. My family n I like Salt n Vinegar Seasoning n was surprised when adding vinegar dIrect apple cider it didn't curd the egg. I did wisk the egg w a little cold water 1st
This recipe is amazing!! We used the batter on oyster mushrooms instead of chicken and it was so delicious. My wife and I loved it! We‚Äôll definitely be using this recipe again.

I loved your recipe but I did modify it for my GF husband.
In the future
This is the BEST and ONLY way I make fried chicken! It not only tastes GREAT, but even when reheated in the microwave, it's still crispy!
Wasn‚Äôt flavorful enough for me. Maybe if I used beer instead of water in the batter, it would have tasted better. The meat itself wasn‚Äôt tasty either. Moving on to look for another recipe.

Really good batter. In the dry dredge I put flour, garlic powder, cayenne, onion power, and black pepper. It came out super crispy and delicious. I used this batter and tossed the chicken in Buffalo sauce for buffalo chicken sliders. They were a hit!
Had to add more seasonings for sure as well egg yokes. A great start but I agree the first one was lacking so I added seasonings and it was bang! Also I used tenders not whole pieces.
It turned out very good, we ate it before I took a picture It wS delicious! Thank you Allrecipes.com.
Too much trouble and mess.

I doubled the spices (did a cowboy seasoning mix over poultry seasoning) and presoaked for 4 hours in a buttermilk, 1tbs paprika and 1 tsp cayenne pepper. Had a good crunch and flavor. Even used the batter to make homemade onion rings with it. Pretty tasty. Although bit of a greasy dinner for my tastes.
This fried chicken is so crispy and delicious. Try adding more cayenne if you're interested in a little more heat.

I‚Äôve made this several times but, instead of beer I do buttermilk and I also use cake flour. Then for my daughter and I, I add 8 slices of jalape√±os, 1 tsp cayenne pepper, 1 tsp white pepper, an additional 1/2 tsp of black pepper and I blend that into the batter. This has been the best recipe so far and my family hardly eats anyone else‚Äôs lol. Thank you!!!

It was very crispy for sure! Next time i will add more water to the batter because it was a little too thick for me. I also added some cajun seasoning to make it a little bit spicier. I will give it one more try before moving on the the next recipe though!
We love this recipe and have made it several times now. So good!
Very Good !!! Best Fried Chicken !!

I add Cajun or blackening spice and seasoning salt to both the dry and wet batter. The fried chicken is just as good, if not better, the next day if you reheat it in the oven at 400 degrees. I've also used this batter on porkchops.
The best I‚Äôve ever had
Great recipe. I had no paprika so I used ground annatto instead.

Skin and skinless quarters. Crunchy outside. Tender and juicy inside. I was a bit confused with comparing the ingredients to the actual amounts in the directions. I used, mostly, what was in the directions. Nevertheless, turned okay. Couldn't get a picture to fit.

Yes this is the Fried chicken recipe I've been looking for.I made 2 batches, one a triple dip and one a double and they were both awesome. I've always struggled with fried chicken until now.This will be my go to fried chicken recipe.

I used peanut oil. I think it needs a bit more seasoning, but this has to be the best fried chicken I've ever made. I also used water instead of beer since we didn't have beer at the house at the time. I'd give this 10 stars if available.
Love this! So easy! We aren‚Äôt beer drinkers so I used Chicken Stock instead. Perfect crispy delicious recipe!
My two college aged sons love this. Its what we make the first night of their visit.

Followed recipe perfectly and found when finished, the batter was hard stodgy and flavorless except a slightly burned flavor. I will not make this again. This was a great disappointment given all of the prep.

This turned out fabulous. So I added some spice to the mixtures based on the reviews saying it was bland. 
I used 2 CS flour for the dry portion and along with the spices listed I added 1 tsp each onion powder, garlic powder and cayenne. This was more than enough for a 2 pound bag of tenders. 
To the wet mixture I used a lager ( was worried about the beer taste- but it was worth it) a TBS of cholula and 1 tsp of poultry seasoning. 
This was spicy and so flavorful! 
I made this outside on a flat top griddle. I place a cast iron Dutch oven right on top of the griddle- high heat and let it heat up. Took about 10 minutes. I used the wooden spoon hack notes by a top review. Worked great. I will make this again.

Not at all spicy. In fact, if I make this again I‚Äôll be adding more salt and some cayenne. I used large boneless/skinless chicken breasts, but I butterfly cut them in half. With the crispy coating half a breast is enough! Great recipe!
I tried this recipe and for the first time my chicken came out great and not burnt, the only difference is I add salt, pepper and some herbs to my chicken before frying.

I was very disappointed in how this turned out. It had zero flavor and while it came out beautifully crispy on the outside, the underside next to the chicken was rubbery. It requires way more spices and maybe using a darker beer for more flavor.
Lousy recipe big thick tasteless texturless bland batter.
Made these for brunch, fingers instead of actual chicken pieces. Skipped the beer and it was so tasty still. I‚Äôve been asked for the recipe.
Overall the recipe was great, however, I would add more spices such as Tabasco or more paprika

I added Old Bay Seasoning to the flour mixture. Other than that, followed the directions, found it super simple. The coating stuck just fine and mine came out just like that in the picture. Family loved the crispiness.

This is probably the best fried chicken I have ever made. Super crunchy and moist inside. I did make it gluten free by substituting with all purpose gluten free flour. And I also took some dill pickle spears, used the same batter and made fried pickles.
Easy to make, and my kids love it.
Way too much dipping. I won‚Äôt make this again
This was crispy and delicious!
Crunchy and bland coatimg needed more spices

I had mine soaking in a buttermilk ranch for a couple hours first, it was too much to do the triple dip after that, but the dry mix is very good. I added 2 tablespoons of Lawry's because I'm a salt fiend. Still playing around with it but a great recipe. I think I did something wrong with the wet mix, I had to add a lot more beer than the recipe called for. It made my husband sad that he couldn't drink the rest. Lol

I have to agree with most persons it was a little bland, even though I added more spices to the chicken and batter.. the chicken itself wasn't moist , but that may be because I made the temperature of the oil too hot. Was looking for crispy on the outside and moist on the inside.
It was just ok

Used this recipe twice in 2 weeks! Family absolutely loved it! I added more salty seasonings, and accidentally over poured too much pepper, but that made it even yummier. Did not have paprika, need to try next time. I also did not use beer, but will definitely do so on the next batch. Any negative remarks on this recipe must be seriously crazy in the cabeza because not even KFC has anything on my fried chicken. Thanks a mil for sharing this fabulous, true to what fried chicken should taste like recipe.
Nice, but it requires much longer cooking time

I absolutely love this recipe. I rinse the chicken in water and by adding some baking powder to the dry mix, I find you don‚Äôt need to dip in the dry then the wet. I go straight from the strainer to the wet and coat thoroughly with the dry. Deep fry it and the family eats it all!
I have found my forever fried chicken recipe
We loved it! We changed the seasonings & used Cavendars & it turned out great!! So crispy, golden, & flavorful! Didn't even need sauce with it!!
My family and Loved this recipe! First time I ever fried chicked from scratch and it is has been added to our meals families favorite dish list.
love this breading!!!

This was a hit with the family. I did use ‚ÄúSlap Yo Mama‚Äù Cajun seasoning instead of poultry and chipotle for the paprika and it was like eating Popeyes spicy chicken. We used chicken thighs with bone and skin and boneless chicken thighs. My son made sammiches with the boneless thighs and a mock Raising Canes sauce he made.

I cook this recipe all the time. I add some more spices to it(usually some Louisiana Cajun seasoning as I live in Louisiana) but it is such a perfect recipe regardless. My wife and kids like a thick batter and thats exactly what you get...Thick, Crunchy,moist and full of flavor.
The crisp was perfect, however, the flavor was rather bland. Adding more seasoning next time.

THIS WAS A HIT!!! reason why I chose this recipe was bc everything was in my pantry and spice cabinet, which was perfect. My 9 year old helped me make it and she absolutely loved making it and of course eating it with a side of honey BBQ sauce!!! We used filleted chicken breast and added a tablespoon of Cayenne pepper (no Cajun) spiciness was on point.
I used this recipe with an air fryer so maybe that‚Äôs what the issue was, but this was the worst tasting fried chicken I‚Äôve ever had. I followed the recipe to a t and it tasted awful.

My first time making fried chicken. It was super crispy & delicious. I only used chicken breast. Next time I will try other pieces, but I wasn‚Äôt sure if I would need to par boil. My son loved it too and he‚Äôs really picky.
A few adjustments to the recipe for taste, but this was delicious! Crispy, flavourful, moist, absolutely perfect
So easy and tasty
Loved this recipe. It was so delicious and crispy and so tasty. I made it afew days ago and my husband is requesting it again tonight. And tasted great the next day too.
Yes we did and it was good little darker then usually but next time to know to turn down oil!

I have NEVER had homemade fried chicken this perfect and delicious before in my life. This method is easier and less messy than pan frying and definitely tastier! (I removed the skin as suggested by another reviewer)

If the recipe didn't turn out for you, the problem isn't the recipe.

The picture is of two bone in breasts after 18 minutes in the deep fryer.
I made the recipe with no changes! Delicious!
Make sure your oil is not too hot. 375 degrees then it should fry at around 350. Don't crowd the chicken in the fryer. Its delicious said everyone.
Was very crispy and not dried out at all but you need to double all the spices it calls for , even then it's still a little bland just throw a ton of spice in it and salt

I changed the seasonings, and used my personal spicy chicken rub. But breading technique is spot on. The most completely breaded and most crispy fried chicken ive ever made. I have pictures but not sure how to upload.
So crispy!!! My family loves this recipe!

I loved this recipe I didn't change anything on it and the whole family loved how crispy the chicken came out! I am going to try it on different cuts of chicken as well (wings, legs and chicken strips).
I made chicken strips with this recipe. Turned out amazing. Everone wants them made again. And the tenders were juicy.
I did use more seasoning than called for and put chicken in salt bath prior. This recipe is a keeper. the crust on the chicken was perfect!
It was delicious 5 stars
Really good but not as thick as you would think.

The crunch was decent but the recipe was very bland and tasted too much like straight flour. I read the other reviews that said the spices were lacking so I doubled up on the measurements and still not very good. The dredging method was good, but everything else was just kind of meh. On to the next recipe!

This is a good solid breading for chicken. As someone who has tried well over 10 breading recipes, I can confidently say that while this isn't the best one - it's pretty good. Not too hard to do, and tastes good.
Almost too crusty.
Have made this several times, excellent
It was definitely crispy. Next time I will add more spices. I give the recipe 5 stars.
absolutely delish!!

Taste was excellent! I added quite a bit more seasoning in the flour, as it never seems to be enough. This again was a great tasting recipe, but it requires a lot of work, and frying chicken in small batches goes on forever....start early!!
I added a little bit of tabasco sauce to the batter mixture and used 1 tablespoon of white pepper instead of black pepper in the flour mixture. My family loved it I would make this again!!
NICE, next time will need a bit more spices and especially salt, otherwise yes it is one of the most crispy chicken I did or had.
Looks and Smells Delicious!!

So delicious!

I do think the flour and batter mixtures were a bit much. I had a ton left over!

I used Pabst Blue Ribbon for the beer batter. Was the only beer I could find in a single can, and it worked well!

I would definitely add about 2 tbsp of cayenne instead of 1.

I recommend keeping the chicken out until it's close to room temperature. It's helps prevent the crust from burning and will cook at a more even rate. Do the larger cuts first like the breast and thighs--then about halfway in, toss in the drumsticks and wings. If you put all of it in at once, cooking will not be even because the meat will cool the oil down. Or you could do the larger cuts as the first batch, then the smaller cuts as a second batch. The larger cuts will still be pretty hot when the smaller cuts finish.

I would also use less beer/water than is suggested so you can get a creamier/thicker batter instead of runny.
I used chicken tenders and they were great. I have been looking for a crispy chicken coating for a while now. I did add a t spoon of season salt. This one is a keeper!!
It was the best. Not so good with wings but thighs and legs perfect.
This is the best fried chicken that I've ever made. I used boneless breasts and cut into strips. The triple dip gave a great cripsy coating that stayed crisp. Excellent.

I loved this recipe the only one I found to make it so crispy but my roommates and I love spicy so instead of beer I did 1 1/2cup of Red Hots hot sauce and about 1/2 cup of water into the batter and mixed until it was not too thick. And in the flour mixture I added red pepper flakes and extra hot Mexican chili powder and it‚Äôs very spicy but really good.
I made this and yummy! Only thing I added was a little minced garlic to the beer batter :) my house and friends believe it's the best recipe ever.
